title: Website Privacy Preferences
content:
A credit union has changed everything they had to login and use their website. I have to call every time I want to pay a bill ,so they can turn something on, or off, showing I am using a computer I have used in the past. It is their security. I was told that, in order for them to recognize my computer I have to turn off, uncheck the box saying to clear my history when I close my browser. I can no longer clear my history or cache if I want to use my bank. There has to be somewhere, to place them in the privacy and security setting so this does not delete what has to be kept in order to have my PC recognized by the worst IT department at any bank, so I don't have make transactions, only during bank hours, and wait 30 minutes on the phone to get this turned off. What instructions can you send me to stop JUST that credit union from being cleared on my History and Cache?

I received this answer from yesterday. Hello, Thank you for contacting Mozilla support! You've reached the Mozilla Support team, where we primarily assist with restoring access to Mozilla accounts and subscription services like Mozilla VPN, Relay, Monitor, and others. Your question appears to be related to another product, such as Firefox. To get community support, you'll need to continue signing into the forum by clicking the blue "continue" button. This will allow you to log in and submit your question to the correct forum. To resubmit your question, please go here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/new/firefox. From there, click the blue "sign in/sign up" button to enter your Mozilla account information, and you’ll be able to ask your question.

title: Firefox is a memory hole.
content: I am using a new Windows 11 computer. I use Firefox for almost everything. But it opens many processes and it very quickly gets to the point where anything I do causes a hang. If I am listening to music or a podcast it pauses and buzzes. This AM I turned on the computer and opened Firefox, without reopening an old session. I had open two windows with two tabs in each window. Using Windows Task Manager I determined that Firefox has twenty-one processes open. Some of them have the efficiency leaf and some do not. I do not use an Add-On manager, but use MalWareBytes for a VPN and protection. Please help.

title: Cannot login to the EU webgate portal
content:
Hello,

I have an account at the EU webgate portal and when I try to open the login screen I get a blank screen, when I try to open it from Firefox on OpenIndiana. Of course, there is no problem when I try to open this page when using Firefox in Windows or Android. The interesting thing is that when I enter the following words to google search

EU webgate login

the first result is the following one

EU Login - server inaccessibility - European Commission

However, when I try the same thing suing Firefox in my smartphone the first result is

My account on EU Login

I really do not understand what is going on! Can you please help me solve this problem?

Regards,

Apostolos Syropoulos

title: How do I import MBOX to Office 365?
content:
To convert MBOX to Office 365, you can use the MacSonik MBOX Converter for Mac. This software migrates MBOX to Office 365 and other email clients, including Gmail, IMAP, iCloud, Thunderbird, and others. Also, this tool converts OLM to multiple file formats such as PDF, EML, EMLX, HTML, MSG, DOC, etc. This tool can facilitate the feature, including removing duplicate emails, backing up emails without attachment files, and renaming the resultant file etc. Additionally, this software is compatible with all Mac OS platforms.

title: Firefox fails to load on MacBookPro laptop
content:
Thank you for volunteering to help Firefox users.

For the past two days, Firefox has failed to load on the MacBook Pro laptop I purchased in June 2022.

When I open the laptop and click on the Firefox icon, a new, blank window tab opens. The tab says, simply: "New Tab." A black ball sways to the left of the words "New Tab," back and forth, left-right-left, endlessly. The window tab never loads a website, even when I type a website address into the address box or prompt box.

The failure first occurred about four days ago. After one day being unable to load Firefox, the next day I was able to, once again. Then, yeaterday and today, I have been unable to load websites and browse them using Firefox.

I am using macOS Sequoia 15.5. And I am using Firefox version 141 (aarch64).

Again, thank you for your assistance.

title: Help reload Bookmarks from backup json file
content: My Mozilla Firefox bookmarks are Bookmarks 2025-07-22.JSON. They worked well on my older Dell computer. I bought a new Dell desktop computer. I am disgusted with Google. I certainly hope you will help me load 2025-07-22.JSON on my new computer - it is ridiculous that Firefox wants to put in the full address on the C Drive instead of simply loading those. On Firefox on my last computer I used News which was bookmarked Daily Wire, Epoch Times, Salem News Channel, God's World News, One America News, Washington Times, New York Sun, and local Sterling Virginia Weather. I also use biography sites https://www.Worldhistory.org and Britannica.com [both of which I pay for monthly, as https://www.wikipedia.org/. I also have a Biography folder with names from A to Z I also have many music folders 1940s, 1950s, 1960s, 1970s, 1980s, 1990's, 2000s, Music group and singers A to Z, Blues music, Bluegrass, Christian Alternative Music, Country classic, Country & Western Gospel, Folk Singers, Jazz, Motown, Soul and many others which I have gathered over the past 10 years Respectfully by irritated and in pain Stephen P Ford, LTC USA Retired, Disabled Veteran [personal info removed for privacy]
